poem:
### The Turning of Tables

In the city's restless veins,  
a new name takes root,  
Zohran, a whisper, a cheer,  
the skyline strains  
to see futures unfold.  
Echoes of dreams,  
the pavement pulses,  
legend out of ink.  
A conventional shade  
fades, as Cuomo turns,  
history in an uptown breath.  
Tomorrow's light,  
cast softly, reimagined.
